attachments.displayName: Students, if ever you are looking for an example of how to handle adversity with fortitude, class and dignity, we give you Steve Bartman. Ten years ago today, the ardent Cubs fan reacted to a foul ball in his reach like 99 percent of the fans in Wrigley Field would have and was vilified in the aftermath of a Cubs National League Championship Series loss. In the ensuing 10 years, he has declined multiple opportunities, and who knows how many millions of dollars, to cash in on his "fame" and instead has lived his life quietly and, by all accounts, fully. In the age of Snooky and "Honey Boo Boo," that is remarkable, exemplary and very, very admirable.
